channel.title: Game Lagging
channel.description: so I used to play DOW II with my friend in coop normally some time later it started lagging and only thing I remember installing was Portal 2. so can anyone help me with this?

item.title: Game Lagging
item.dc:creator: Assassin
item.description:
thnx all for help but I found out the reason. it was because that the heat sink wasn’t tightly with CPU and thermal paste was dried as well. I fixed that and now it is averagely 50 C.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Lagging
item.dc:creator: CPU
item.description:
1. Pull out your motherboard manual and read precisely what order the memory needs to be installed and verify that you are doing it correctly.
  2. Check your virtual memory settings (page file) set it correctly then reboot for it to take effect.
  3. Run memtest to verify memory integrity.
  4. Check out Microsoft’s performance options. https://support.microsoft.com/search/default.aspx?query=How+to+set+performance+options&catalog=LCID%3D1033&mode=r

Read full topic

item.title: Game Lagging
item.dc:creator: Assassin
item.description:
well, maybe this will help: when game used to play good I had 3x 512mb memory cards in, and through the sides weren’t even (1024mb and 512 mb) it worked well, after I installed fourth 512 mb card cpu usage went to high. when I had only 1x 512 mb card CPU usage at idle was max 10% now it is 20-25%.

Read full topic

during game I only run steam and stop all unnecessary processes.

item.title: Game Lagging
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Think you might just have a lot of stuff running. If you can afford to get rid of programs you don’t need, do so. Also are your hdd’s enarly full? Ideally you should have space to move.

item.title: Game Lagging
item.dc:creator: Assassin
item.description:
I cleaned Graphics card its temperature is 53, also the temperature I mentioned ( 59 C ) was of graphics card, there was GPU written and I mistook it for CPU.
I installed program recommended up and there are 3 temperature values for CPU
Dicode 1 - 93 C
Internal - 36 C
Dicode 2 - 38 C

Read full topic

item.title: Game Lagging
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
Assassin:

what does that mean?

Idle: When your computer isn’t running anything - just on the desktop. It’s generally a good idea to try to keep your idle CPU temperature below 45 - 50°C.

Load: When your computer is running something demanding like a recent game or a performance benchmark. Best to try to keep temperatures under load below 80°C. Most CPUs have a built-in failsafe that shuts off the system once it gets too hot (the cut-off temperature is usually 90°C or 100°C.

DOW 2 can cause some pretty high system temperatures if your cooling is inadequate, so it might be a good idea to check your CPU and video card temps after playing the game for a few minutes.

I recommend CPUID HWMonitor for checking system temperatures: https://www.cpuid.com/softwares/hwmonitor.html

Read full topic
